website_summaries.verdict: If you're switching your kitchen to stainless steel cookware, you'll want to give this model a try. It features a stainless steel cooking pot.
pros: Comes in choice of 6 cup, 14 cup and 20 cup models
Inner pot is made of 100% surgical-grade 304 stainless steel
One-touch operation with automatic Keep Warm function
Can cook many different kinds of rice
cons: Thick, starchy steam can spray out the steam hole onto the counter
Rice on the bottom can scorch if you don't unplug the unit right away

customer_reviews.title: Pot works as expected but it is not solid stainless and the plating came off into the food so we returned it.
customer_reviews.text: The pot worked as expected and does have a tendency to sputter and bubble out through the cover lid vent. That would be acceptable but we returned it as the pot is not solid stainless steel. It is plated and the interior plating started to flake off after only a couple of uses.into the food. I was not willing to take a chance with my health by eating flakes of whatever plating material is used in the fabrication of the "not so stainless" pot. The light colored spots in the picture are the spots where the plating came off exposing a different metal underneath. Maybe they are getting shortchanged by their supplier?
customer_reviews.author: rbeny

customer_reviews.title: Spits and splatters. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy it. This rice cooker is dangerous. It spits and splatters the contents and hot water within a 1 metre radius. We can't use it as a result. I can't seem to contact anyone from Aroma via this website to request a refund and return the product.
customer_reviews.author: TAS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent results and NO TEFLON!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and NO TEFLON! Make your steel cut oatmeal in this too (add raisins, cinnamon -- whatever you like) and, unlike when making rice which requires the cover, leave the cover off. For rice cooking, liquid spews lightly from the cover's little porthole; I do not believe this is a design flaw or can be avoided, I do however have a simple solution: prop a small dish on the cooker when making rice and splashing will be contained (see picture attached).
customer_reviews.author: Mavis

customer_reviews.title: Hot water splatters everywhere when cooking just 2 cups of rice
customer_reviews.text: I was convinced having read NUMEROUS reviews, that this was my rice cooker. Pros: - Many good reviews - Stainless steel, can cook 2 cups easily, and up to 7 if needed. - Doesn't burn rice at the bottom of the pot. Cons: - When cooking just two cups of (uncooked) rice, scalding rice water spurts everywhere. Can't imagine what it would be like to cook more! For ~$60 more, I am getting a pressure-cooker / rice-cooker by Instapot. Recommend that route over this format of rice cooker.
customer_reviews.author: jess

customer_reviews.title: Its annoying and I cannot get it to work
customer_reviews.text: I am a south Indian and rice cookers are an everyday thing in my household and for my family and friends as well. We have used a lot of rice cookers over the years - Aroma and others . But never had one that doesnt work! This one simply goes into the keep warm even BEFORE the rice is done. Its annoying and I cannot get it to work. I am not sure I can ask for a refund now - (we ordered this right before an India trip and this is a stand by) grrrr _ I donot know if the problem is with just this piece or if Aroma is just making crappy products these days..
customer_reviews.author: Deepthi

customer_reviews.title: Negative reviews are right! Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before buying and two negative points stood out:1- this pot spatters during cooking 2-the pot coating flaked off after short use. I decided to purchase anyways but got the Asurion warranty in case I need a replacement. Yes, it spatters and makes a mess and yes it flaked off but the warranty doesn't do replacement. They only refund after you return the item and they approve! Luckily for me it was within amazon return window but I lost what I paid for warranty!
customer_reviews.author: Elham

customer_reviews.title: Hack to switch "warm" to OFF!
customer_reviews.text: My first Aroma batch! Raw 1.5 actual cups (2 rice-standard-measure scoops) made the 3 actual cups pictured. I used scarified California medium grain brown rice, which uses 1:1 rice:water like white rice, but claims nutrition identical to brown rice (kids like it better, too). Hint: Search "Mechanical Countdown Timer grounded pin" if you want your cooker to switch completely off after the "warm" cycle kicks in. I just set it for an hour when I start my rice and forget it — solved for $12.
customer_reviews.author: TL8

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I could not find anything except non-stick rice cookers where I live. After a couple of years of moderate use, the non-stick surface begins to flake off and I would buy a new one. This cooker has a sturdy stainless steel pot that should last a very long time. Although some say food sticks to the stainless steel surface, I haven't really found that to be the case. When I've cooked my rice, I put water in the pot and set it aside until I'm ready to do dishes and I have had no trouble at all. This cooker is a great value and I shouldn't have to buy another one anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Dena

customer_reviews.title: It is a piece of crap! not even a one star because it didn't even cook one batch of rice?
customer_reviews.text: A gift for my girlfriend, she just opened it today! Turned it on to make rice, and it seemed to start working then stopped. Repeated attempts to plug it in to a different outlet that worked would not turn on the rice maker. What a gift!!! And Amazon states the window to return it...July 5. It was a gift and so how can that be? Faulty product and no recourse?
customer_reviews.author: daband

customer_reviews.title: Great for steel cut oats
customer_reviews.text: I love this little appliance. We cook steel cut oats every morning for breakfast, and this cooler makes them perfectly in under 30 min. I add oats and water at night and let them soak overnight in the cooker, and turn the cooker on when I get home from the gym. (It also cooks well without soaking, but I prefer the texture and it saves me time in the morning.) By the time I’m out of the shower and dressed, they’re done. It also works really well for brown rice and other grains. This is the second unit I’ve bought just to get an extra pot, but my original has been going strong with daily use for 3+ years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 35 years of making rice. This cooker is TERRIBLE!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been making rice for my entire life. I’m half Japanese, so rice is a daily staple in our diet. We needed a quick replacement cooker and decided on this one. DO NOT BUY IT!!! I can’t emphasize enough how terrible it makes rice. It’s never cooked the rice evenly. Half the pot will either be mushy or it’ll be crunchy and undercooked. I’ve tried so many different amounts of water, of course following the directed amounts, then varying amounts to try to remedy the inconsistency of rice texture. Unfortunately I’m outside the return window, so I’m just going to throw it away. Please do not buy this rice maker. It’s terrible!
customer_reviews.author: Macs, Motorcycles & Music

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this little rice cooker for about 10 months now, once a week. Have been very happy with it cooking Nishiki medium grain rice in it. Always wash the rice first by rinsing in a rice colander and comes out well. I get minimal to none of the spluttering that I see others are experiencing. Even cooking the maximum amount I do not have this problem. Always unplug as soon as I hear the little click that it is done with cooking. Do not leave on the warm setting. Then remove it with potholders and set it on the stove to cool a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: highmetab

customer_reviews.title: Works well but rice sticks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rice cooker because the one that I had been using for the past five years made by the same manufacturer quit. It works almost exactly as well. My old one had a non-stick lining. Since this one doesn't, I oil the bottom. I only eat brown rice, and it cooks it to perfection. If I soak it a minute or two before I wash it, it cleans up easily. All you do is oil it, add water up to the pre-measured line, add rice, place lid, plug in, push button down, and wait 45 minutes. Perfect rice. I'm glad I bought it and will buy this brand again, hopefully in five years.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Cottrell

customer_reviews.title: Good no-frills rice cooker - nice stainless steel bowl insert
customer_reviews.text: This is a good rice cooker - love the stainless steel bowl. I've gone through many rice cookers and eventually, the coating inside the bowl always seemed to start peeling off. I was concerned about ill effects from the coating, so I was looking for a stainless option. It's not the fanciest rice cooker. You have to plug it in to turn it on and unplug to turn it off. If you leave it plugged in after cooking the rice, it stays on the "stay warm" function. I wouldn't suggest leaving it to warm for very long or the rice on the bottom gets a bit dried out.
customer_reviews.author: Spokannie

customer_reviews.title: good rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this cooker a lot. Using the steamer rack while cooking rice prevents the mess from the rice. Like many rice cookers, cooking rice does splatter everywhere. Using the steam rack eliminates that problem. I also have to leave some water in the pot (or heat it up a bit) to help soften the stuck rice on the bottom of the pot. (not a big deal especially because using stainless is safer than non stick coatings.)
customer_reviews.author: Kax

customer_reviews.title: Rice cooker......
customer_reviews.text: I like the look and feel of the stainless steal pot, and its easy to clean. I would have given more stars but I'm disappointed with packaging. This product was supposed to come with an accompanied "bamboo rice spatula" - it wasn't in the box. What was in box was a "hard plastic" spatula, not the flexible heat resistant type. This is hard, no bending. Even though the edges are rounded, to me this looks like it would ruin the pot so not using it. Where is the bamboo rice spatula?
customer_reviews.author: lkfrslmt

customer_reviews.title: cooks rice perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This is my second rice cooker. I will never go back to cooking rice on the stove. This rice cooker is so easy to use. I do put a little more water in with the rice and sometimes if dinner isn't ready, I just heat the cook button again. The rice always comes out delicious. I use this several times a week. It has been a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Favdoggy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For A Simple Task
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of those people who forgets that they are cooking, so appliances automatic shut-offs are a mandate. This little unit does exactly what it's supposed to do, and does it well. My only criticism is that what they call a "cup" is actually 3/4 cup. Why not simply specify "3/4 cup"in instructions? Silly decision on marketing's part! Still does a great job tho'.
customer_reviews.author: J. O.

customer_reviews.title: Your next rice cooker upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: I have been hobbling along with the rice cooker I’ve had since college (also an aroma) with the old rough metal pot. Finally decided to get a new one with a stainless pot. Totally not disappointed. So easy to clean and cooks as good or better than my old pot. If there is an adjustment it’s that it’s doesn’t turn off but goes to warm - e.g. don’t forgot to go in to the kitchen and unplug it at some point. Aroma is a solid product. What else do you guys make?
customer_reviews.author: Gaston A. Hinostroza

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Stainless steel - so no scratching like non stick over time. No sticking or burning - if you rinse the rice until the water is clear and take the inner pot out when it switches from cook to warm. Dishwasher compatible. Cons: None so far NOTE - If the water starts to bubble out of the vent and make a mess, just lift the lid up and set it back at an angle leaving a gap (to create a larger vent) and not fully closing the lid, until the bubbles dissipate. I've had this problem with all rice cookers I've owned over the years and this trick always works.
customer_reviews.author: Sh R

customer_reviews.title: Best budget friendly rice cooker!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this rice cooker!!! Rice is a staple in my house and when my old Asian rice cooker broke it pained me to think of spending that much money on a Tiger or another expensive brand. There are only 2 people in my household and this is perfect for us! My favorite part is that it is stainless steel. I didn’t want a nonstick inner pot as I am trying to transition out of using teflon products. I also read reviews about the lid opening being too big and spewing out water. I was hesitant to purchase this rice cooker but mine did not have that problem!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 3-4 people!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for 3-4 people. I bought a smaller one previously, but felt that I was always making a bit too little amount of rice. This one is just the right size, and because it is quite a bit larger, I don't fill it up to the top which helps keep it from bubbling over. Like many reviews, the hole in the top is large and the steam and rice water does splatter out, but I figured out that if I put my metal tea strainer over the hole I don't have to clean up a messy counter afterwards. This might be a nuisance to some folks, but it's doable for me.
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: Burns everything
customer_reviews.text: Update: Completely stopped working within six months of purchase. Most regrettable purchase ever. Somehow this is really poor about judging when the food is done. I've made rice and quinoa in it and 9 times out of 10 it burns the bottom layer while there is still water on the top. Too bad my return window is now closed. Never had this problem with an identical rice cooker with a nonstick vessel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3.5 years of easy-cookin' (and counting)
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I purchased this bad boy 3.5 years ago after we got married and it's been with us working flawlessly ever since. not sure what the complaints are about this product, as it does exactly what it was created to do. okay, the rice can be a bit sticky to clean off afterwards, but let it soak with dish soap and water for 15 minutes and you'll be good to go. this is a fantastic, reliable product. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: makes a huge mess
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker makes a huge mess regardless of how much rice you try to cook. Even when making just 2 cups of rice it spits out ricey water all over the counter and floor. I rinse the rice before hand until the water runs clear. The mess is ruining our floors and counter and takes us longer to clean up than just using the stove. Don't buy this rice maker.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Goldfarbmuren

customer_reviews.title: Buy this instead of one of those souped up electronic ones.
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint about this is that, because I wanted a stainless steel cooker with no nonstick coating, I have to soak the rice pot sometimes because a little of the rice sticks to the bottom. Small price to pay for a safe machine. I have FINALLY rid my kitchen of evil non stick coatings! This thing works like a chrm and makes better rice than you could ever make in a pan on the stove-top. It reverts to warming mode when the water is completely absorbed, thanks to its elegant magnet reaction mechanism. I may buy a larger one for dinner parties.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: The thing I like about this one is how easy it is to clean after use. I feel better about the stainless steel interior than I did about my old aluminum nonstick rice cooker. The old one had more features, but we really did not use those much. This little white rice cooker looks so nice there on the lower shelf of my cart.
customer_reviews.author: Alynny

customer_reviews.title: favorit rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: I love the size. The max amount of rice is 3 cups. I love that it is stainless steel so I don't have to worry about chemicals leeching or scratching and then I had to replace the pot or buy a complete whole unit. This is my favorite rice cooker because it is light, portable, and so easy to use! The price is much affordable than the other rice cookers. My favorite is that only a very thin layer gets stuck to the bottom and sometimes, no rice gets stuck to the bottom, which means no waste. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Stainless Steel Pot
customer_reviews.text: Likes: 1. manufacturer used quality food grade stainless steel for internal pot. 2. perfect size for 2 person family. 3. no chemical coating in the internal pot. key reason why i discard my previous "non stick" rice pot. varieties coating chemical used in the "non stick" cooking pot are either carcinogen or never been tested by FDA or any consumer agencies. (note: PFOA free doesn't mean the substitute chemicals used have been thoroughly tested or approved.) Dislike 1. no "power off" switch. only two switches: "cook" or "keep warm". user must unplug the power socket to power off cooker. Conclusion: highly recommend everybody to purchase this pot for health reason.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect description & returned
customer_reviews.text: Item was received on time but was not what we expected. Item description said 14 cups of cooked rice capacity and the received packing says 4-14 cups. However, the inner pot revealed the inner reality. It is so small and just double the size of our 3 cup (cooked) rice cooker. Inner pot is clearly engraved as 7 cups cooked capacity at the top of the rim. Requested return authorization ASAP and will return it tomorrow. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Venkata S. Kothamasu

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I've had this almost a year and have found it to be very disappointing. The rice never seems to be cooked correctly, the measurements specified in the instructions aren't even close to accurate and when u use it the water boils out everywhere making a mess. A ton of rice sticks to the bottom each time and there seems to be a mix of mushy rice and undercooked rice. I had a cheaper unit prior to this that made perfect rice every time for about 10 years before it died. I dont understand why such a simple device would be so problematic
customer_reviews.author: weekendwarrior

customer_reviews.title: Totally cooks rice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted the stainless steel pan. Yes you will get some rice stuck to it but you just soak it and clean it like a regular pot. Afterall before rice cookers, regular pots were used. This is just convenient because you're saving space on the stove. Smaller than I thought though. I don't see how it could cooks 3 cups of rice. I put in two cups and the cooked rice reached the top of the lid. But really I never make more than two cups anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love this rice cooker.. have been looking for one like it for years.. Price is excellent fastest shipping ever from Amazon.. and to top it off it makes perfect rice.. I have used many different ones over the past 50 years and this is just like my first ones.. I cant tell you enough times how much I love it.. will be getting another as a back up for my red rice.. when I have loads of people over.. when it says 3 cups uncooked it means 6 cups cooked.. PS the Insert pot ( that holds the rice is really well made nice and sturdy. no spitting while cooking, and cord is generous enough in length..
customer_reviews.author: MS DO IT YOURSELF

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for 100 ml of rice. Rice at 1:2 100 ml rice 200 ml water and some olive oil cooks very fast. It would be very easy to boil over with larger portions. After the cook cycle I add a little water and let it sit for at least 15 minutes. The rice on the bottom is easer to remove then. Needs an off switch. If you see white spots on the metal it is the starch from the rice. Oil it before use.
customer_reviews.author: TONY Box

customer_reviews.title: As expected, rice stuck to the bottom of the ...
customer_reviews.text: As expected, rice stuck to the bottom of the pot, and rice water does indeed spew out of the steam vent during cooking (which got on the kitchen counter and such). Nonetheless, the health benefits of using a stainless steel pot (versus using non-stick Teflon pot) makes up for this. As some reviewers said, when cleaning the stainless steel pot for the first few times, there is a sort of greyish residue that comes off when I wiped it with a paper towel. I did some research on this, and it's a thin coating added on during the manufacturing process to give it its shine, and apparently it is harmless? I am not sure about this, however.
customer_reviews.author: 3xxx

customer_reviews.title: stainless steel rice cooker is better and this is a good one
customer_reviews.text: I read a review that a user said that he/she chipped off a piece of stainless steel coating. He/She suspected that was a "fake" or "painted coating" to look like stainless steel. When I read that review, I almost did not purchase this product. I am glad that I finally decided to buy this rice cooker. The best one I ever have. It is not cheaply made coated aluminum. It is real stainless steel!
customer_reviews.author: annyms

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but creates a mess
customer_reviews.text: Pro: cooked rice doesn't stick to the bottom. Con: when rice starts to boil, it shoots up steam through the vent and into the kitchen counter. I've seen this happen with my previous rice cooker too, but with less mess
customer_reviews.author: Brandon F.

customer_reviews.title: A good cooker, wish it was a different color
customer_reviews.text: There is not much to say about this. It is a basic wonderful rice cooker. I just wish it was a different color than white. It stains a little too easily. If it was available on a different color that doesn't stain that easily, would've liked it. Other than that, it has done perfectly fine for now. We make rice daily so this is pretty much a daily driver in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Safe and excellent rice cocker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one about two months ago and found it is a perfect product. Previously, I used Black Deck rice-cocker with tefelon. Usually, the surface will be gradually damaged in half year and we have to replace a new one about one year. This rustless steel inner pot is perfect for our no worry health consideration . The price is only 40 to 50% higher than Black Deck and less than half of other so-called advanced programming rice cocker. Therefore, according to my experience, this one should be ranked in the top 1 as judged by no-worry-health and price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Just wants to have a non nonstick rice cooker, I was willing to deal with the cooked rice sticking and the reported splatter while cooking. Happily by unplugging after cooking, like you would turn of the fire when cooking rice in a pot, I avoided the first, and I didn’t have a problem with the second. Maybe they enlarge the hole or maybe it’s the kind of rice one cooks that cause the splatter. The stainless steel pot is pretty solid and is thicker in the bottom for a more even cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Naldox

customer_reviews.title: Best stainless steel rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: I got this mainly for the stainless steel inner pot which is good quality. I like that you can remove the lid entirely to wash in the sink, unlike some rice cookers with lids attached, which you can only wipe down - can't clean thoroughly. I hope that they can make a version which can slow cook as well. Not sure why there are no slow cookers with stainless steel inner pot. If Aroma enhance this rice cooker to add the slow cook function, I will be the first one to buy :)
customer_reviews.author: JustValue

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you know how to wash your rice
customer_reviews.text: I chose this one for its simplicity and the stainless bowl. It is obviously higher quality; the bottom of the rice bowl is nice and thick. This cooker cooks evenly and fast, is super simple to use and looks beautiful. Several customers complained about the unit spewing rice water of the vent hole. I have not had this issue, but I always carefully wash the rice and get rid of all rice dust and rice flour. I'm very happy; with this rice cooker!
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian B Huydts

customer_reviews.title: Works great! But leaves a burnt crust at the bottom
customer_reviews.text: Works just like you expect a rice cooker to. Good volume and pot is sturdy. Only downside is that after cooking, it tends to leave a burnt layer of rice at the bottom (No matter how much water I add) which is difficult to clean off.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Don’t think so...
customer_reviews.text: One Star because it’s cute and easy to clean but it heats up like Mount Vesuvius and it over cooks the rice ...once the rice is a total mess the cooker switches to warm. Dang, what a waste of money....
customer_reviews.author: Bidwell

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Enjoying the stainless steel interior. It is easy to clean. Most non-stick cookers have a coating which is scratched over a period of time. Don't have to worry about this one. Just don't over fill with water and you won't have problem with water spitting out of the hole on the lid as mentioned by other buyers
customer_reviews.author: Michael L

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy cooker.  Easy to clean and NO Teflon!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rice cooker. Works great. Easy clean up. NO TEFLON! So all good. It does create a mess while cooking as it shoots bubbly rice liquid up from the small hole in the lid that vents off steam. So the counter is always a disaster afterwards. I usually put a dish towel under it and sometimes one on top to keep the liquid spray in check.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: the worst rice cooker ever!
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker is the worst rice cooker I have ever had. It does not cook rice evenly. When the light goes off and indicates the rice is done, the rice on top is undercooked, still partly raw, while the rice on the bottom is done and soft. I tried many times, varying different amount of water but no improvement. Once I tried to add more water just to see if I can get the top rice to cook thoroughly, but no luck. Even when it was supposed "done", the top rice was undercooked and the bottom rice still had water around it.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Witte

customer_reviews.title: Good rice cooker for single person
customer_reviews.text: This unit is ok. it does its job. I wanted a stainless steel pot because all the other makes have an aluminum pot that becomes dark after a few months of use. If you try to cook three cups then water would overflow from the vent on the lid. I cook no more than two cups of rice or vegetable rice or rice and lentils with spices that go very well. food gets stuck at the bottom of the pot and it gets dried out. This is the only complaint I have so far.
customer_reviews.author: xxx

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLE AND THE FASTEST RICE COOKER
customer_reviews.text: This is the FASTEST RICE cooker ever! I have used rice cookers for the past many decades. This is the best because the rice is cooked much faster than the other rice cookers and it is STAINLESS STEEL without the non-stick chemicals. much better than many of the nonstick or multi function rice cookers. I bought 3 of them, 2 for myself and one for my parents. I highly recommend this rice cooker for anyone who cooks rice. I also bought steamer. PERFECT GOOD QUALITY RICE COOKER.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Simple, simply amazing. What a clever little machine.
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing. Where has this been all my life? It is truly a special product. It’s so simple yet provides consistent results. Probably the best appliance I’ve ever purchased. We wash our rice, but there are good things and bad things in doing so. I recommend doing some research on, “should you wash your rice”. On one hand, you remove some pesticides but you are also removing some of the nutrients.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Bowie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rice cooker!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. I have a gathering every Thursday that I need to cook more rice for. If you buy a rice cooker, you need to buy one with a stainless steel pot like this one. Just received it yesterday and used it last night. I LOVE AMAZON. Saves time of searching and shopping!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Lee Ramie

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Bought based on reviews and wanted to switch to a non-coated pot. On first use, cooked rice got dry on top and soggy at the bottom after 2 hours in warm mode. 6 hours later, the bottom layer got encrusted. Tried it for the 2nd time using little less water and got the same result. We've owned rice cookers for decades and this one is the worst we've had. Perhaps it's just a defective model but we're not taking chances and returning it back.
customer_reviews.author: Skeered1

customer_reviews.title: Water gets EVERYWHERE!
customer_reviews.text: Water gets EVERYWHERE when you cook just one cup of rice. The stainless steel is also a hassle to clean and has to be soaked to get the burnt rice at the bottom off. Not a fan!
customer_reviews.author: Maddie T

customer_reviews.title: NOT a 14-cup rice cooker!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 14-cup rice cooker with the not-unreasonable expectation of a machine that would make 14 cups of rice. Is that unreasonable? Well, apparently so. After receiving it, I have discovered that when they say 14 cups, they mean the supplied cup (which is actually only 3/4 of a cup) not an actual cup. What a crappy thing to do! I am very disgruntled and will return immediately, for fraud! :-(
customer_reviews.author: Iretnil

customer_reviews.title: Rice without a side of Teflon
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker works so well and is not full of Teflon which makes it safe to eat out of. I love it, it has lasted years and still cleans up like it's brand new. You can cook white rice, brown rice, quinoa and other grains and it comes with a cook book along with the owner's manual. It is small so if you are really into eating rice then you may need a bigger one. For us, we are only 4 people and we can get away with 2-3 cups just fine. This will give you flawless rice without the chemicals of the non-stick versions out there. Thank you Aroma for giving us a stainless steel alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Severson

customer_reviews.title: Splatters a little, but can be fixed.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time today. Worked as expected, but as other reviewers mentioned, as it's cooking it splatters rice water quite a bit. A six inch ring of aluminum foil around the edge fixes that, but it's a shame any "fix" is needed. Small price to pay for stainless steel. You can't convince me any version of non-stick surface is safe!
customer_reviews.author: Jason McKenna

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I made brown rice in it. While the product listing didn't mention brown rice that I saw, the booklet that comes with the cooker has instructions and it came out perfect. Happy with stainless over aluminum or the non-stick models. It was easy to clean. I was surprised at how small it actually is, but it makes 6 cups of rice which is plenty and works well for my day-to-day needs.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela H.

customer_reviews.title: Splatters all over the counter. I should have read MORE negative reviews
customer_reviews.text: Splatters all over the counter. I should have read MORE negative reviews. Now I am a week past return date and this was my purchase for rice to solve all my dinners but now I cannot use it without a huge mess. Sadly will go back to cooking on the stove. I tried less water and rinsing the rice, soaking it to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: DandelionHeads

customer_reviews.title: It's a good little cooker and I did what many are suggesting ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a good little cooker and I did what many are suggesting - 1. Put some oil in the container and put it all over (paper towel). 2. I washed my rice in a bowel first, then added it to the container. 3. Cook! 4. Turn off immediately when it is done (aka unplug). 5. LET IT SOAK for a while (overnight) and do NOT use abrasive washing stuff. Soap and sponge. CON: They shipped it in the actual rice cooker box and it was damaged. Lucky that it didn't ding the cooker. I suggest that it gets put into an Amazon box; then shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I've been cooking rice all my life using many rice cooker. This one seem to have dry rice stick to the bottom the most no matter how much I adjust the water amount. The longer you leave it on "Worm" the more rice get dry and stick to the bottom. On the bright side, it is very easy to clean and don't need to worry about scratching.
customer_reviews.author: Tim V.

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful
customer_reviews.text: In general very happy with the rice cooker. I have noticed when cooking brown rice you will often need to remove the rice before it switches to warming mode, otherwise rice will stick to the bottom of the bowl. Multiple reviews have complained about rice sticking, but it is very easy to clean. My only complaint is no on/off switch, but must be unplugged when not cooking or in warming modes.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L.

customer_reviews.title: Small, stainless
customer_reviews.text: It tends to bubble starchy water from the vent in the lid. I rinse the rice about a half dozen times before cooking, but it still does it. This is pretty much a one person pot, maybe enough for two.
customer_reviews.author: John Carder

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but splatters
customer_reviews.text: This is a small, classic rice cooker. It is easy to clean because the bowl is made of stainless steel and the glass lid is completely removable. The only problem is that when you don't rinse the rice, in order to make it a bit "sticky", the starch bubbles, raises the lid and splatters all over the place. It would be better if there was a way to keep the lid in place. Just be prepare to clean around, or place a heavy object on the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Rick L

customer_reviews.title: Still waiting on customer service - update, received replacement
customer_reviews.text: Love the stainless steel bowl, but other than that, it has been a total failure. It sprays water from the lid, like a water fountain. The front part where the switch came off at the top with and is hanging by the base. It stopped working within few weeks..Had purchased extended warranty, when contacted , was asked to contact the manufacturer , as it falls under the manufacturer warranty but when try to contact the manufacturer it goes straight to voice mail and no call back after I left a message. Total disappointment. Update: Finally contacted customer service , received replacement for one and another one is on the way. Changed my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Hema

customer_reviews.title: No more non-stick material flaking off! :)
customer_reviews.text: This was everything I asked for. I was tired of worrying about the non-stick coating on my old one flaking off into my food. Now I don't have to worry about that with this stainless steel one. As for clean up, it's pretty easy. If there is anything stuck on the bottom - a quick soak, and it comes right off.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: It's an ok rice cooker. It does spit and splatter from the lid when cooking the rice (I've never had a rice cooker do this, I've been cooking rice in rice pots for years and years). The rice turns out great! The rice does stick to the bottom and get crunchy hard when left on warm. I bought this rice cooker due to the stainless steel pot.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Good stainless steel rice/grain cooker.
customer_reviews.text: I like this rice cooker especially because it has a stainless steel cooking pot. It is easy to operate/clean and the rice cooks nicely. My only constructive criticism is that I am unable to turn off the automatic warm setting. My preference is that, when the rice is cooked, the pot would turn off completely instead of going to 'warm,' which never shuts off until I shut it off. I want to be able to "forget about it" instead of remembering to turn it off manually. Still, I will recommend this cooker because of the size and the stainless steel pot.
customer_reviews.author: G. Busher

customer_reviews.title: Love it but it FAILED Friday night.
customer_reviews.text: I love this rice cooker. It is used every Friday night when kids and Grandkids come for chili night. Have 5 people who like rice with their chili. Last Friday night it kept clicking from cook to keep warm. Then it just quit cooking at all. I will have to figure out how to contact someone about this. Forgot to mention I have three other Aroma's that are old and work great. Read the warranty info and it's not worth trying to send it back. Also I usually do three dry cups of rice but last Friday night I used 4--could that have caused the failure. Shouldn't have
customer_reviews.author: Cabincreek

customer_reviews.title: Great little rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few years now so I feel it's time to leave a review. This works consistently and will occasionally slightly overcook brown rice when the exact directions are used but is otherwise an awesome rice cooker. Easy to clean, relatively small footprint for the volume it cooks. A great option if you don't want to be exposed to teflon.
customer_reviews.author: MLavore

customer_reviews.title: not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the cooker for couple of months and used it less than 5 times. One day, i noticed that the cooker was no longer round, it had turned to oval shape!! (this is the cooker itself, not the stainless liner part). I tried to bend it back to shape and was only able to do so minimally. I have no idea why this happened, there was no other damage... tried to contact manufacture via Amazon order, but that link did not work. and return window has closed. This is not a sturdy product, made of aluminum? or something very soft and fragile.
customer_reviews.author: michaelR

customer_reviews.title: No teflon required.
customer_reviews.text: Rice does not stick to the pot. I can see that scratches starting to show due to scrubbing. I believe later on when the shine in the pot disappears, the rice will begin to stick. The same surely happens to teflon coated pots. On the good side, I do not have the risk of ingesting the teflon. I like this one better than teflon coated pots.
customer_reviews.author: Joven

customer_reviews.title: Poor kid design, gets too hot at the bottom/heating element.
customer_reviews.text: Poor design & quality. I’ve only had 9 months. There was a stopper in the steam hole that came off so it doesn’t steam the rice, rice sticks to the bottom, so the bottom is burnt & the rice is uncooked. I tried to order a part but there’s no way to contact tech support. It just shows photos of the user manual.
customer_reviews.author: K&GB

customer_reviews.title: Makes a mess during cooking process.
customer_reviews.text: It spits rice water out of the hole in the lid and makes a mess. We put it in the sink. It spits all over the sink and faucet, but the mess it makes is easier to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: SuzanneS

customer_reviews.title: Over all a Good unit. SS insert is the icing for this model.
customer_reviews.text: Good cooker. Aroma has been in this space for a while now and it has finally come out with a SS insert. So like that. one Complain I have is that I am wondering if I got a NEW piece as there were scratches and paint was smudged and dark spots on the side of the controls. This is a replaced piece as the first one broke in 3 uses. See pictures. Since these were cosmetic defects I still kept it. keeping fingers crossed that this shall last longer that the previous one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No auto shut off!!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I can return it, I wish I could. This rice cooker does not have auto-shut off as my old one had. It is not very clear from the instructions. Something like this, should be in the WARNING section. First time I used it, I did not turned it off until it started to smell. I guess it is in the name "Aroma" and I should not complain. Now, I can't clean the burned off rice with out scratching the pot. Goes right into trash.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail Zilbergleyt

customer_reviews.title: L.O.V.E.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a rice maker with non-stick pan... the "non-stick" surface had never been truly non-stick and had been chipping off for sometime. I can't believe that ALL the rice makers don't come with a stainless steel pan like this one does! Rice did not stick to sides at all and the bottom, although "coated" with rice, came up immediately upon stirring with included bamboo paddle. SUPER easy to clean, no worries about non-stick flakes in my rice, made perfect rice!
customer_reviews.author: Chemine Mulford

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: Rice sticks to the bottom in a hard layer. Impossible to scrape off. Had to soak and scrub with steel pad to clean. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Hamburger Chef

customer_reviews.title: Stainless!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally got rid of the Teflon coated rice cooker I had. The teflon was starting to flake off. This one, the bowl is stainless. Easy to clean and to cook. Dishwasher safe. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size & no Teflon!
customer_reviews.text: Love the size of this rice cooker. I ordered it as it’s stainless steel & doesn’t have Teflon coating which I believe isn’t healthy to cook with. It makes it a little tougher to clean but no big deal!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in three uses.
customer_reviews.text: It worked a grand total of three times, then would go into 'warm' mode before rice was cooked. The Amazon return window was closed, so called company directly for return. They're sending a new one, but it's taking forever. As is, unimpressed with product and service. Will update if replacement pot blows my mind.
customer_reviews.author: K. Crist

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase!! It makes more like 5.5 cups than 6 cups. I like my rice very fluffy. I did have to go through a second cooking cycle for the rice to fully cook, but it was no big deal. Very easy to clean even though it’s stainless steel. And even easier to use!! Even my husband, who never made rice in his life, was able to use it. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this stainless steel cooker!
customer_reviews.text: This cooker makes perfect rice and doesn't feed my family tiny flecks of nonstick coating like almost every other rice cooker on the market. We love this stainless steel cooking pot. I thought it would be difficult to clean, but it's not. Any additional soaking/scrubbing is way worth the peace of mind that comes with cooking in this stainless steel pot. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Kinsey

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile appliance.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased so far with my purchase. I use it for rice, soup, pasta just about anything. I haven't had a problem with any mess from the steam vent. Also no problem as of yet with anything sticking to the stainless steel cook bowl. Edit: no cooking oil or butter used when cooking the rice or pasta. That was a surprise for me.
customer_reviews.author: mrabren

customer_reviews.title: Easy use and reliable Aroma Rice Cooker with 304 grade stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Aroma products since last 5 years. Aroma products are very quality products, reliable and long lost. This product is very good because of strong stainless steel inner pot made specially for regular use and it is long lost because of 304 grade stainless steel. Cook time also reasonable and auto switch off option is very convenient
customer_reviews.author: Badam.Ramesh

customer_reviews.title: Does not work straight out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: Just received today and tried to use. The “cook” button does not stay down and, instead, it stays in the “warm” position permanently so I was unable to cook my rice. I will be returning this product. I saw a video that someone posted with the same problem. Too bad, my previous rice cooker was the Aroma brand and has worked well for years. My only reason for getting a new one is the pot is aluminum and is starting to show signs of corrosion so I wanted a stainless steel pot. Such a huge disappointment that it doesn’t work straight out of the box!
customer_reviews.author: seanne619

customer_reviews.title: Happy camper
customer_reviews.text: I'm so pleased with the stainless steel container. No more worrying about unhealthy chemicals from nonstick or easily scratched cheap ceramic materials. Surprisingly this is easy to clean. Many times I don't even have to soak it at all, the dish pad scrubs the rice residue easily off.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Solid So Far!!!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid. The only CON is when the water gets really hot it boils over the pot and makes a really big mess. Not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: JOSHINA ROBINSON

customer_reviews.title: Working great for me
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy several rice cookers over the years once the non stick started to show wear and tear however careful maintenance. At last great to buy a rice cooking inner pot made of stainless steel whch is bottom thick and rice does not stick to the bottom if left in warm longer than I intend to. Easy maintenance and dishwasher friendly. The inner stainless steel pot extremely versatile. Use it as a mixing bowl. Wish the cooker was also made of stainless steel for easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Hema Venkat

customer_reviews.title: One person oatmeal and stainless steel interior
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to be used for making oatmeal and it works perfectly. It has stainless steel interior and exterior, yet very easy to clean. I use it to make oatmeal and add a bit of coconut milk to help it not stick to the pot. Works perfectly and so easy to clean. Best rice cooker on the market. I also use it to make quinoa and buckwheat.
customer_reviews.author: Lblush

customer_reviews.title: Simple rice cooker that does it’s job for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for a simple rice cooker: one that would perform this one simple task well without costing a fortune. I didn’t want a slow cooker or a steamer, just a rice cooker. This item fits the bill perfectly, once you get the hang of rice to water ratios and the proper flavoring. It does spew out a bit of moisture while it’s cooking, but other than that I am very happy with this rice cooker. Also, I like the stainless steel inner pot and the size - it can accommodate cooking for two or a family.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: Great rice cooker By Aroma >Great Taste >Fluffy Rice >Stainless Steel inner Pot Main reason I bought this is stainless steel inner pot and it was on sale if you have a large family go with the 8 cup which takes 4 cups of uncooked rice to makes 8 cups of cooked rice. My model takes 3 cups of uncooked rice and makes 6 cups of cooked rice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it was easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: The Aroma rice cooker spits starchy water a foot or two out from the cooker through the vent hole and bubbles out around the rim. I used it twice. The first time I didn't rinse the rice (because that's my usual way of cooking) and I filled the required amount of rice and water for 6 cups of cooked rice (the max this unit can hold).The second time I rinsed repeatedly and only made enough for four cups of cooked rice. Both times starchy water spattered far around the unit. On the plus side, it was easy to clean. I returned the unit.
customer_reviews.author: joel

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use, love the stainless steel!
customer_reviews.text: I love it so much because is made by stainless steel, I feel safe and Very easy to clean. Very good size if u have small family , maybe 3-4 people. Most time only me and my boyfriend we only cook two cup of rice that’s great enough for both of us.
customer_reviews.author: annabella

customer_reviews.title: Non Stick So Far
customer_reviews.text: The rice cooker does its job and so far has been easy to wash. The rice has not adhered to the stainless steel pot. I wanted this cooker because I think it is healthier to avoid non-stick coatings (i.e. teflon) on pots and pans. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Big Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Not dishwasher safe
customer_reviews.text: This product works as intended but IS NOT dishwasher safe as advertised. After a single run in the dishwasher (normal cicle) you can see small dark patches were the material has deteriorated (not just stained), very disappointing. Maybe not stainless steel after all.
customer_reviews.author: Dayelis

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working at 9months...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement for a small black and decker one I've had for about 4 years. I let my parent borrow that one, but they loved it so much I let them keep it and bought this one. I used it about 1-2 days a week. Everything was great, until this week when it would no longer turn on. It's only been 9 months as I purchased in August of 2019. I would not recommend this product, it's a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Neither cooker worked
customer_reviews.text: The first one didn’t work. Got a replacement and this one doesn’t work either ! Amazon won’t even refund me the entire amount. I’m very upset with this rice cooker and amazons return policy on replacements. I should have just got a refund and bought it again. The problem with both cookers was it switched to warm before the food was done. I couldn’t cook anything.
customer_reviews.author: MQ

customer_reviews.title: Great rice cooker plus moldy paddle
customer_reviews.text: The rice cooker is good, sturdy quality and a great value for the price. My grievance is that the serving paddle that came with it was TOTALLY MOLDED. That really makes me feel uneasy about how clean the other parts are as well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The cooker is easy to use, just add the rice and sufficient water. The cooked rice would be ready with single switch. I don't see many pre-programmed cooking methods. It's claimed to cook 7-cup uncooked rice. But it can handle up to 5 with my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Eswara Rao Ambati

customer_reviews.title: I bought this as a backup to an exact model
customer_reviews.text: A price reduction was an incentive to make another purchase. I love the stainless steel insert without concerns of peeling non-stick coating. I have this rice cooker for years and a backup purchase made a lot of sense for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren B

product_meta.title: Aroma Simply Stainless Rice Cooker, White [Cooks 3 cups of uncooked rice]
product_meta.description: Size:6-Cup Cooked| Style Name:Rice CookerEnjoy easy home cooking with the Aroma Simply Stainless Rice Cooker. Restaurant-quality rice. Healthy steamed meals. Delicious one-pot dishes. Prepare all this and more at the flip of a switch! Aroma takes the "cook" out of home cooking - turning kitchen time into your time! Help the kids with homework, get creative at play time or pick up that novel you've been waiting to dive into. All while delivering hot, hearty and healthy meals the entire family will love. This convenient cooker's compact capacity Cooks upto 3 cups of uncooked rice [3 cups of uncooked rice = 6 cups of cooked rice]. Once the rice has finished, it will automatically switch to Keep-Warm so there's no need for monitoring or stirring. It's also perfect for oatmeal, chili, jambalaya, soups and so much more! The cooking pot is made completely of surgical-grade 304 stainless steel for worry-free cooking and superior results. And when the cooking is done, the inner cooking pot and all accessories remove for easy cleanup in the dishwasher. Rice Measuring Cup and Serving Spatula included. Steam Tray sold separately.
feature_bullets: COATING FREE INNER POT: The food-grade 304 stainless steel cooking pot is durable and dishwasher-safe for easy cleaning.
AUTOMATIC COOKING: This smart rice cooker detects when your rice is ready, so you don't even have to set a timer. Then, it automatically switches modes to keep your rice warm!
COMPACT SIZE: This powerful rice cooker is a must-have kitchen tool in a small package. The 6-cup capacity is perfect for rice, omelets, soups, oatmeal, pasta, and more.
COMPLETE SET: We include a bonus rice spatula and measuring cup, which are BPA-free. Plus, the spatula can be held in the handle for easy storage.
ONE-TOUCH: Pour in up to 3 cups of uncooked rice, add water, and push down the lever to start. The one-touch, automated design is fool-proof. Just set it and forget it!

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars5,124 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
